hook.text: Every cell in your body has a clock. When those clocks fall out of sync, everything suffers.

buildup.text: Circadian rhythms run on a roughly 24-hour cycle, controlled by the suprachiasmatic nucleus in the brain.

discovery.text: Light exposure resets these clocks daily. Morning sunlight tells your body to wake up and start performing.

twist.text: Screen light at night tricks the brain into thinking it's daytime. Melatonin drops and sleep quality plummets.

climax.text: Respecting your circadian rhythm is the single biggest lever for sustainable energy.

punchline.text: Your body clock runs the show. Respect it or pay the price.

quiz.question: What resets circadian rhythms each day?
